medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of childhood hypophosphatasia due to skeletal changes and low serum alkaline phosphatase.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 1.4 years old, with pectus excavatum, large anterior fontanel, and rachitic skeletal changes. The patient has experienced multiple pathological fractures in lower extremities since age 8.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient lost most of his deciduous teeth shortly after they appeared and has dental caries in his permanent teeth. He has undergone surgical treatment for multiple fractures.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are healthy without symptoms of hypophosphatasia; the patient has two older sisters who are also healthy.
